snippet: The president has approached conflict, and dealings with terror groups, as a chronic but manageable security challenge rather than an all-consuming national campaign.
abstract: Pres Obama is poised to become first president to serve two complete terms leading nation at war, despite efforts to fulfill campaign promise to end wars of predecessor George W Bush; Obama is likely to leave office with continued American military involvement in conflicts in Afghanistan, Iraq and Syria; situation reflects changing nature of war and realities of governing.
lead_paragraph: The president has approached conflict, and dealings with terror groups, as a chronic but manageable security challenge rather than an all-consuming national campaign.

headline.main: For Obama, an Unexpected Legacy of Two Full Terms at War
headline.print_headline: For President, Two Full Terms of Fighting Wars
